name: df-itgm
body: |- wceq(citgm, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, cuni(crn(cmeas)), cfv(co(cfv(cmetu, co(cv(s0), csitm, cv(s1))), ccnext, cfv(cuss, cv(s0))), co(cv(s0), csitg, cv(s1)))))
comment: Define the Bochner integral as the extension by continuity of the Bochnel integral for simple functions. Bogachev first defines 'fundamental in the mean' sequences, in definition 2.3.1 of [Bogachev] p. 116, and notes that those are actually Cauchy sequences for the pseudometric ` ( w sitm m ) ` . He then defines the Bochner integral in chapter 2.4.4 in [Bogachev] p. 118. The definition of the Lebesgue integral, ~ df-itg . (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 13-Feb-2018.)
